column2: 1. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column6: go to work.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 2. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column6: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column10: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

column2: 3. When you see this sign you should:
column4: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 4. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 6. When passing a vehicle,  it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you look over your shoulder and see no vehicle behind you.
column6: the driver you just passed signals you over.
column8: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror.

column4: Two roads join from the left
column6: A road joins from the right
column8: All traffic must go straight ahead

column4: Two-way Traffic
column6: School zone ahead
column8: Keep right

column4: One-way street ends
column6: One-way street begins
column8: Divided highway ends

column2: 10. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column4: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column6: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column8: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column10: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 12. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: drive fast to let off steam.
column6: listen to loud music while driving.
column8: have a few drinks before driving.
column10: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.

column4: Side road
column6: Yield sign ahead
column8: Side road entering from the left

column2: 14. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column6: you cannot pass.
column8: you cannot change lanes.

column2: 15. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column4: Pedestrian crossing
column6: Merging traffic ahead
column8: Come to a full stop

column4: Do not use your phone while driving
column6: Emergency line available
column8: Phone service ahead

column2: 18. A pedestrian is crossing the street in a crosswalk. You must:
column4: drive off as soon as the pedestrian has moved past your car.
column6: sound your horn and proceed with caution.
column8: stop and let the pedestrian cross.
column10: slow down and go around the person at a slow pace.

column4: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column10: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

column2: 20. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.
column6: get to your destination much faster.
column8: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.

column2: 21. When an emergency vehicle approaches using a siren, lights or other warning devices, you must:
column4: come to a complete stop as soon as you can see the emergency vehicle in your rearview mirror.
column6: drive to the nearest intersection and stop.
column8: move to the right side of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
column10: reduce your speed and drive with caution.

column4: give directional information.
column6: guide drivers.
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: right turns are not allowed.

column4: The traffic signal is broken.
column6: Slow down before entering.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 25. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
